questions.question: What is a concrete noun?

choices.answer: A person, place, or thing you can see.
A person, place, or thing you can hear.
A person, place, or thing you can touch.
All of these describe concrete nouns.

imageMetadata.resources: Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash

questions.resources: Photo by Aaron Burden on Unsplash

questions.question: How are abstract nouns different from concrete nouns?

choices.answer: You cannot see, hear or touch abstract nouns.
You cannot see, hear, or touch concrete nouns.
You can only use your senses for abstract nouns.

questions.question: Identify the abstract noun in the sentence: The kids had a happy childhood.

questions.question: How many abstract nouns? The boy showed happiness at school and courage with his friends.
Which is a characteristic of an abstract noun?

choices.answer: Abstract nouns name a specific thing, like New York.

questions.question: Identify the abstract noun in the sentence: The author puts love into each page she writes.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the word “taste” as an abstract noun?

choices.answer: Mike does not like to taste pepper in his sauce.
Mike has good taste in music and movies.
